description: This course provides a significant placement in a school setting for students wanting to explore a career in teaching or gain greater understanding of teaching as a profession. Directed by host teachers, students may observe, assist within the classroom, tutor, teach, coach, attend faculty meetings and functions, and meet with school personnel. Students attend orientation sessions on campus before placements begin, complete assigned readings and reflective writings, and present on their school experience during on-campus sessions following the placements. Offered alternate January terms, odd years. Counts as the January term requirement for the TEFL certificate education concentration. Prerequisite: EDUC 295.
name: Exploring Teaching
notes: This course includes an academic civic engagement (ACE) component.
